source:
**Building Dimension load**

This notebook loads data to deltalake table etlhubConfirmed.DHT_BUILDING by sourcing data from Tririga system.
The file is pulled to datastage server using SFTP protocol.

The CSV formatted file is uploaded to adls for loading to BUILDING deltalake table created.

ERDM Industry Sector Link: https://erdmuiapp-prod.wdc1a.cirrus.ibm.com/erdmStandardDetails/102

ERDM Link: https://erdmuiapp-prod.wdc1a.cirrus.ibm.com/erdmAllStandards/0

from azure.storage.blob import BlobClient
import pandas as pd
from io import StringIO
from pyspark.sql.functions import md5, concat_ws
from sqlite3 import connect
from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql.functions import col
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
from delta.tables import *
import os
import sys
from datetime import datetime

account_name = 'adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast' # fill in your primary account name 
container_name = 'etlhubfilestorage' # fill in your container name 
relative_path = 'extract/Tririga/Files/' # fill in your relative folder path 
relative_archive_path='archive/'
file_name='IWTRIRIGABuildingQuery.csv.20220704' 
natural_key1="CAMPUS_ID"
natural_key2="BUILDING_ID"
natural_key="BUSINESS_ID"
MinimumTririgaBuildingCount=750
MinimumTririgaCampusCount=450
tablename="etlhubConfirmed.dht_building"
stagingtable="DHTS_BUILDING"
keycolumn="BUILDING_KEY"
date = datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%I:%M:%S_%p")
extract_dt = datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %I:%M:%S") #This is batch/cycle date. It would be common for all the rows inserted in a single run
rec_start_dt=datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %I:%M:%S") #This should ideally from the source system. If source doesnt have any date column, use current date 
print(extract_dt)
Copy source CSV file to archive folder including timestamp in file name

#Read data from adls csv file extracted from source at 
https://adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast.dfs.core.windows.net/etlhubfilestorage/extract/ERDM/DS_INDUSTRY_HIERARCHY_DATA.csv

adls_path = 'abfss://%s@%s.dfs.core.windows.net/%s' % (container_name, account_name, relative_path) 
print('Primary storage account path: ' + adls_path) 

adls_arch_path = 'abfss://%s@%s.dfs.core.windows.net/%s' % (container_name, account_name, relative_archive_path) 
print('Primary storage account path: ' + adls_path) 

relative_archive_path
# Read a csv file 
csv_path = adls_path + file_name
arch_fil_name=file_name.rsplit(".")
csv_archive_path = adls_arch_path + arch_fil_name[0] + '_' + date + '.' + arch_fil_name[1]
print (csv_archive_path)

incrementalData_DF1 = spark.read.csv(csv_path, header = 'true')

#incrementalData_DF = incrementalData_DF1.withColumn('BUILDING_BUSINESS_ID', concat_ws("CAMPUS_ID", "BUILDING_ID"))

incrementalData_DF = incrementalData_DF1.withColumn(natural_key, concat_ws("~", natural_key1, natural_key2))

incrementalData_DF.write.csv(csv_archive_path, header = 'true')

# Get column list for creating Rec_Checksum

#Add checks for duplicate data, Check for 1. dups in source data based on natural Key and
# 2. Dups in target already

col_list=[]
for i in incrementalData_DF.columns:
    col_list.append(i)

# Add a checsum column to help identify the changed rows

incrementalData_DF1 = incrementalData_DF.withColumn("nk_hash",md5(natural_key))
incrementalData_DF2 = incrementalData_DF1.withColumn("column_hash", md5(concat_ws("", *col_list)))

#sell_cyclecolhashDF.show()
incrementalData_DF2.createOrReplaceTempView("incrementalData_DF2")

#Create a dataframe with target deltalake table data with necessary columns

existingDataDF=spark.sql("SELECT * FROM {}  WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y'".format(tablename))
#existingDataDF=spark.sql("SELECT tgt.* from etlhubConfirmed.DHT_EMPLOYEE tgt WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y'")

existingMaxKeyDF=spark.sql("SELECT MAX({}) existing_MAX_KEY from {} WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y'".format(keycolumn,tablename))

#existingMaxKeyDF=spark.sql("SELECT MAX(EMPLOYEE_KEY) existing_MAX_KEY from etlhubConfirmed.DHT_EMPLOYEE tgt WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y'")

# prefix all columns from target table with 'existing_'. This will help to differentiate columns when incremental and existing DF's are joined

existingDataDF1 = existingDataDF.select([F.col(c).alias('existing_'+c) for c in existingDataDF.columns])

existingDataDF1.createOrReplaceTempView('existingDataDF1')

fullJoin1=incrementalData_DF2.join(existingDataDF1, col(natural_key) == col("existing_" + natural_key), "fullouter")

fullJoin2=fullJoin1.join(existingMaxKeyDF,None,"CROSS")

fullJoin2.createOrReplaceTempView('fullJoin')

fullJoin2.write \
  .format("delta") \
  .mode("overwrite") \
  .option("overwriteSchema", "true") \
  .option("path", "abfss://etlhubfilestorage@adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast.dfs.core.windows.net/deltalake/staging/{}".format(stagingtable)) \
  .saveAsTable(stagingtable)
   #.option("overwriteSchema", "true") \  .save("") \

Data Validation Checks :

- Check for duplicates in Source data based on natural key
- Check for partial data from source. That is if the file has expected number of rows
- Check for duplicates in target delta lake table based on natural key
- Referential Integrity checks

qry3="""
SELECT COUNT(*) as CNT, {} FROM incrementalData_DF2 GROUP BY {} HAVING COUNT(*)>1
;
"""

qry4="""
SELECT COUNT(*) as CNT, {} FROM {} WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y' GROUP BY {} HAVING COUNT(*)>1
;
"""

qry5="""
SELECT * FROM incrementalData_DF2
;
"""

df3=spark.sql(qry3.format(natural_key,natural_key))
cnt1=df3.count()

print (cnt1)
if cnt1 == 0:
    print("No Duplicates in source data")
    status = 'success'
else:
    print("Below are the duplicates in source:")
    df3.show()
    status = 'fail'
    #os.abort() this will take the spark cluster also down
    sys.exit(1)
    print("This will not be printed")

df4=spark.sql(qry4.format(natural_key,tablename,natural_key))
cnt2=df4.count()

print (cnt2)
if cnt2 == 0:
    print("no duplicates in target delta lake table")
    status = 'success'
else:
    print("Below are the duplicates in target delta lake table:")
    df4.show()
    status = 'fail'
    #os.abort() this will take the spark cluster also down
    sys.exit(2)
    print("This will not be printed")


df5=spark.sql(qry5)
cnt3=df5.count()

if cnt3 >= MinimumTririgaBuildingCount:
    print("The number of rows in source data is more than the threshold, data can be processed")
    status = 'success'
else:
    print("The source data is having less number of rows than expected. Please check:" )
    print(cnt3)
    status = 'fail'
    #os.abort() this will take the spark cluster also down
    sys.exit(2)
    print("This will not be printed")

#Below code can be used to evaluate if the DMLs are successful or not Exception handling purpose

qry_4_recon1="""

SELECT COUNT(*) from {} A 
WHERE existing_REC_CHECKSUM is null
AND NOT EXISTS
(SELECT 1 FROM {} B
WHERE A.{}=B.{}
and b.CURRENT_IND='Y'
AND A.column_hash=B.REC_CHECKSUM)

"""
df_4_recon1=spark.sql(qry_4_recon1.format(stagingtable,tablename,natural_key,natural_key))
print('New records or Inserts are:') 
df_4_recon1.show()

qry_4_recon2="""

SELECT COUNT(*) from {} A 
WHERE LOWER({}) = LOWER(existing_{}) 
and LOWER(column_hash) <> LOWER(existing_rec_checksum)
AND NOT EXISTS
(SELECT 1 FROM {} B
WHERE LOWER(A.{})=LOWER(B.{})
and b.CURRENT_IND='Y'
AND A.column_hash=B.REC_CHECKSUM
)
;

"""
df_4_recon2=spark.sql(qry_4_recon2.format(stagingtable,natural_key,natural_key,tablename,natural_key,natural_key))
print('Changed records or Updates are:') 
df_4_recon2.show()

#Insert for New rows which are missing in target and present in source based on Natural Key.
#delete FROM etlhubconfirmed.dht_employee;

qry_4_recon1="""
SELECT COUNT(*) from {} A 
WHERE existing_REC_CHECKSUM is null
AND NOT EXISTS
(SELECT 1 FROM {} B
WHERE A.{}=B.{}
and b.CURRENT_IND='Y'
AND A.column_hash=B.REC_CHECKSUM)

"""
df_4_recon1=spark.sql(qry_4_recon1.format(stagingtable, tablename, natural_key, natural_key))

qry_ins_new_rows="""

INSERT INTO {}
	select 
	COALESCE(A.existing_MAX_KEY,0) + ROW_NUMBER () OVER (ORDER BY {}) AS {} 
,	1 AS VERSION
,   BUSINESS_ID
,	CAMPUS_ID
,	BUILDING_ID
,	BUILDING_NAME
,	BUILDING_STATUS
,	BUILDING_OWNERSHIP_NAME
,	BUILDING_OWNERSHIP_DESCRIPTION
,	BUILDING_PRIMARY_USE_NAME AS PRIMARY_BUILDING_USE_NAME
,	BUILDING_PRIMARY_USE_DESCRIPTION AS PRIMARY_BUILDING_USE_DESCR
,	BUILDING_SECONDARY_USE_NAME AS SECONDARY_BUILDING_USE_NAME
,	BUILDING_SECONDARY_USE_DESCRIPTION AS SECONDARY_BUILDING_USE_DESCR
,	REPLACE(RENTABLE_AREA,',','') AS RENTABLE_AREA
,	ACTIVE_YEAR AS BUILDING_ACTIVATION_YEAR
,	ACTUAL_RETIREMENT_INACTIVATION AS BUILDING_INACTIVATION_YEAR
,   'Y' AS CURRENT_IND
,   '{}' AS EXTRACT_DT
,   '{}' AS REC_START_DT
,   '9999-12-31 00:00:00' as REC_END_DT
,   'Tririga' AS SOURCE_SYSTEM
,    column_hash as REC_CHECKSUM
,    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP as IMG_LST_UPD_DT
,    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS IMG_CREATED_DT
    from {} A 
WHERE existing_REC_CHECKSUM is null
AND NOT EXISTS
(SELECT 1 FROM {} B
WHERE A.{}=B.{}
and b.CURRENT_IND='Y'
AND A.column_hash=B.REC_CHECKSUM)
;
"""

d=spark.sql(qry_ins_new_rows.format(tablename,natural_key,keycolumn,extract_dt,rec_start_dt,stagingtable,tablename,natural_key, natural_key))

%%sql
SELECT min(BUILDING_KEY), MAX(BUILDING_KEY) FROM etlhubconfirmed.dht_building 
--where CAMPUS_ID ='RTPMAIN'
    --like 'RTPMAIN%' --and BUILDING_ID='404'

#Update or expire the rows with existing instance of the changed rows:
qry_4_upd_changes_rows="""

MERGE INTO {} A
USING {} B
ON A.{} = B.{}
AND LOWER(B.{}) = LOWER(B.existing_{}) 
and LOWER(B.column_hash) <> LOWER(B.existing_rec_checksum)
AND A.CURRENT_IND='Y' AND A.REC_START_DT=b.existing_REC_START_DT
WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET CURRENT_IND='N'
    ,REC_END_DT= existing_REC_START_DT -  INTERVAL 5 seconds --current_timestamp --existing_REC_START_DT-1
    ,IMG_LST_UPD_DT=current_timestamp
;
"""
f=spark.sql(qry_4_upd_changes_rows.format(tablename,stagingtable,natural_key,natural_key,natural_key,natural_key))

#Insert for changed rows which are missing in target and present in source based on Natural Key.

qry_ins_changed_rows="""
INSERT INTO {}
	select 
    existing_BUILDING_KEY
,	1 + existing_VERSION
,   BUSINESS_ID
,	CAMPUS_ID
,	BUILDING_ID
,	BUILDING_NAME
,	BUILDING_STATUS
,	BUILDING_OWNERSHIP_NAME
,	BUILDING_OWNERSHIP_DESCRIPTION
,	BUILDING_PRIMARY_USE_NAME AS PRIMARY_BUILDING_USE_NAME
,	BUILDING_PRIMARY_USE_DESCRIPTION AS PRIMARY_BUILDING_USE_DESCR
,	BUILDING_SECONDARY_USE_NAME AS SECONDARY_BUILDING_USE_NAME
,	BUILDING_SECONDARY_USE_DESCRIPTION AS SECONDARY_BUILDING_USE_DESCR
,	REPLACE(RENTABLE_AREA,',','') AS RENTABLE_AREA
,	ACTIVE_YEAR AS BUILDING_ACTIVATION_YEAR
,	ACTUAL_RETIREMENT_INACTIVATION AS BUILDING_INACTIVATION_YEAR
,   'Y' AS CURRENT_IND
,   '{}' AS EXTRACT_DT
,   '{}' AS REC_START_DT
,   '9999-12-31 00:00:00' as REC_END_DT
,   'Tririga' AS SOURCE_SYSTEM
,    column_hash as REC_CHECKSUM
,    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP as IMG_LST_UPD_DT
,    existing_IMG_CREATED_DT
from {} A 
WHERE LOWER({}) = LOWER(existing_{}) 
and LOWER(column_hash) <> LOWER(existing_rec_checksum)
AND NOT EXISTS
(SELECT 1 FROM {} B
WHERE LOWER(A.{})=LOWER(B.{})
and b.CURRENT_IND='Y'
AND A.column_hash=B.REC_CHECKSUM
)
;
"""

e=spark.sql(qry_ins_changed_rows.format(tablename,extract_dt,rec_start_dt,stagingtable,natural_key,natural_key,tablename,natural_key,natural_key))

qry3="""
SELECT COUNT(*) as CNT, {} FROM incrementalData_DF2 GROUP BY {} HAVING COUNT(*)>1
;
"""

qry4="""
SELECT COUNT(*) as CNT, {} FROM {} WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y' GROUP BY {} HAVING COUNT(*)>1
;
"""


df4=spark.sql(qry4.format(natural_key,tablename,natural_key))
cnt2=df4.count()

print (cnt2)
if cnt2 == 0:
    print("no duplicates in target delta lake table")
    status = 'success'
else:
    print("Below are the duplicates in target delta lake table:")
    df4.show()
    status = 'fail'
    #os.abort() this will take the spark cluster also down
    sys.exit(2)
    print("This will not be printed")

#Below code can be used to evaluate if the DMLs are successful or not Exception handling purpose

%%sql
select distinct IMG_CREATED_DT from etlhubconfirmed.dht_building --WHERE CURRENT_IND='Y'
    --EXTRACT_DT
